Title: Manager, Marketing & Advanced Analytics
Description: Position Title: Manager, Marketing & Advanced Analytics  What you will do:   Lead, manage and deliver advanced analytics that supports enterprise strategy, leveraging predictive modeling techniques, and translating complex methodologies into clear insights, compelling visualizations, and tangible actions that engrain analytics into business decisions. Supports vision for marketing and sales departments, delivering automated reporting and robust analytical approaches with goal to strengthen demand generation, conversion, and loyalty.  What you will do:   Lead role in helping to align organization around foundational Sales and Marketing KPIs, which includes incremental sales / margin, breakeven analysis, deep dive analysis, and any other analytical methodologies to assess or predict performance. Identify and develop robust test plans, optimized segmentation, and analytics best practices by evaluating and improving targeting, forecasting, and post mortem dive methodology.  Instill a deep intellectual curiosity and commitment to learning in order to solve critical business problems and push the boundary of our capabilities. Drive profitable growth through the introduction of predictive models to drive cross-sell, upsell, conversion, and lifetime value. Optimize approaches to predict response, impact, and opportunity to drive more effective, targeted, and personalized communication.  Develop actionable segmentation to drive targeted communication that connects touch points across advisor journey. Perform sub-segmentation to identify best customers, and deep dive analyses to better understand behaviors and needs. Synthesize 360 insights to provide holistic, actionable recommendations to stakeholders.  Develop and prioritize new reporting dimensions, automated dashboards and compelling visualizations that effectively measure, track, and quantify drivers of performance and marketing programs with the goal to optimize demand allocation in the pipeline, drive accountability and inform stakeholder decisions.  Identify advanced statistical and analytical techniques and leverage programming languages to mine through a wide range of data sets and isolate patterns across sources. Introduce new approaches to drive cutting-edge insights, and instill enterprise focus on client/advisor experience with analysis of net promoter and text analytics.  Key leadership role for marketing analytics, including management of internal team members and external vendor partners. Establish strong relationships with key stakeholders and work with business partners to execute strategy throughout the organization. I ndependently lead large scale studies and present findings across the business by translating complex analysis into clear insights and opportunities.     What you need to have:     Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university required; majors in Marketing, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field preferred.  Masters in Computer Science, Math, Statistics preferred (or M.S. in related field with 5 years' experience applying data mining techniques to real business problems)  5 or more years' experience with advanced analytics / Data Science  Expertise in one or more statistical software packages (e.g. R, Python, SAS)  Deep understanding of Machine Learning and Data Mining techniques  Experience building large data sets across disparate sources (e.g. SQL)  Ability to summarize complex findings clearly and concisely.  Strong conceptual, analytical, and creative thinker.  Experience building and automating reports and dashboards that provide insight into acquisition and retention.     What we give you in return:  Our competitive Health program offers a comprehensive benefits package that supports healthy lifestyles, preventative care and helps to protect against hardship. Our retirement plan offers our employees the opportunity to plan for a strong financial future well beyond their working years.  About Cetera Financial Group:  Cetera Financial Group ("Cetera") is a leading network of independent retail broker-dealers empowering the delivery of objective financial advice to individuals, families and company retirement plans across the country through trusted financial advisors and financial institutions. Cetera is the second-largest independent financial advisor network in the nation by number of advisors, as well as a leading provider of retail services to the investment programs of banks and credit unions. Through its multiple distinct firms, Cetera offers independent and institutions-based advisors the benefits of a large, established broker-dealer and registered investment adviser, while serving advisors and institutions in a way that is customized to their needs and aspirations. Advisor support resources offered through Cetera include award-winning wealth management and advisory platforms, comprehensive broker-dealer and registered investment adviser services, practice management support and innovative technology. *" Cetera Financial Group " refers to the network of retail independent broker-dealers encompassing, among others, Cetera Advisors, Cetera Advisor Networks, Cetera Financial Institutions, Cetera Financial Specialists, First Allied Securities, and Summit Brokerage Services . Cetera Financial Group is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. For us, this is the only acceptable way to do business. Accordingly, all employment decisions at the Cetera Financial Group, including those relating to hiring, promotion, transfers, benefits, compensation, and placement, will be made without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, age, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic characteristics, religion, religious dress and/or grooming, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, U.S. military status, political affiliation, or any other class protected by state and/or federal law. Please Note: Cetera does not accept unsolicited Agency resumes. Any unsolicited resumes received from Agencies will be considered the property of Cetera unless specifically requested by Human Resources. Unsolicited resumes will be ineligible for referral fees.

Title: Product Marketing Manager, North American Digital Services
Description: We are seeking a Product Marketing Manager to help build our data commercialization and monetization strategy, develop business and marketing requirements, and grow revenue within North America (NA). You will be responsible for supporting thedevelopment of strategy and go-to-market approaches for our digital connected vehicle and mobility (non-fleet) third-party data services and products in NA, as well as competitive analysis and benchmarking.Data products include, but are not limited to APIs, data marketplaces, algorithms, tools, services, and capabilities that generate revenue from data. You will have knowledge of regulatory/privacy requirements, operational requirements, needs, and nuances within given markets or countries that may vary from the global data monetization strategy.You will partner with the in-region Ford Smart Mobility strategy teams to understand the market fit for the solutions that we are defining, andto develop business and marketing requirements for the solutions.You'll work closely with the product owners/managers on the high-level product strategy, and support product feature prioritization, and support product launches with in-market pricing, bundling, and launch strategies.The successful candidate will also be charged with conducting market analysis, developing demand generation programs, assisting with go-to-market strategies, selling, working alongside the regional marketing leads to reach the target audience for each product, and generating increase in revenue and market share.Key responsibilitiesConduct market analysis to determine areas where to play, and strategies on how to win for specific data products.Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates your products in the market, developing product pricing strategies and structures, understand cost components across the data supply chain.Market intelligence - be the expert on your customers, how they consume and their buying criteria; be the expert on your competition and how to crush them; Gathering all market information; Conducting competitive research and analysis; Understanding market trends.Demand generation - develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand for your products.Sales enablement - communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and support the sales process of your products; Overseeing the creation of sales and marketing tools.Product launch - plan the launch of new data products and releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan.Regulatory requirements - understand NA and specific country regulatory and privacy requirements, nuances, and standards.Partner with colleagues globally for coordinated strategies, platforms, and product design features as necessary.Willing to travel 50%Required QualificationsBachelor's degree in in Business, Data Science and Analytics, Computer Science, Econometrics, or Finance8+ years of data, mobile, or software product marketing experience with at least 5 years' experience in the data monetization/brokerage domain, with focus on strategy and distribution for large consumer base5+ years developing data science products and data monetization business models5+ years of experience gathering requirements for agile software development5+ years design thinking or user design experience5+ years delivered / marketed software services for large enterprise customers5+ years proven experience working in-market, and a demonstrated knowledge of data regulatory and privacy lawsPreferred Qualifications:Masters degree in in Business, Data Science and Analytics, Computer Science, Econometrics, or FinanceOutstanding organizational skills, as well as strong verbal and written communication skillsDetail oriented - demonstrated capability and experience in project tracking, gathering, analyzing and tracking dataAdaptability to a rapidly changing environment and rapidly growing teamAbility to work across multiple tasks simultaneouslyAbility to manage multiple stakeholders and to recommend and implement informed choicesProven ability to work independently, proactively and efficiently within established guidelines and proceduresExperience in agile software implementationInherently curious and believe in the power of data to drive decisionsExperience in data management and data quality pipelines is an added advantage.Self-driven with the ability to work in a self-guided mannerStrong attention to detail and delivery track record.Excellent communication, presentation (both oral and written) and influencing skillsExperience using MS Word, Excel, Access, Power Point, and VisioProven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology developmentAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentVery strong oral and written communication skillsVery strong analytical skillsExcellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues and cross-functional teams, and third parties.The distance between imagination and ... creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you'd expect from a diverse global leader. You'll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products - and it is always ready to go further.Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Title: Software Engineer – Image Processing

Machine control or robotics experience is highly desired.Experience delivering highly successful and innovative products.Experience with any Object-Oriented programming (Python, C#, Java or C++)Experience with TensorFlow a plus but not a mustWillingness and ability to improvise. Title: Senior People Analytics Analyst IV - (B4)
Description: The Applied Materials “HR Reporting and Analytics” team (HR&A) is seeking an individual with strong business acumen and analytical skills to act as an internal consultant on key workforce issues. The HR Reporting and Analytics Team’s mission is to “provide insights that help optimize business using evidence-based decision-making.” In this role, you will support evidence-based decision making on Human Capital, design, develop and implement data-based solutions that have a direct and measurable impact. As a People Analytics Analyst, you will work with HR and the business in achieving business results by using talent data to inform and improve decision-making. This position will utilize data analysis methodologies, tools and approaches to provide insights. This individual will be responsible for translating business objectives and challenges into analytics priorities, communicating the analytics findings to influence and inform business decisions and solve high-value problems. The individual must be highly data driven, technically proficient, creative, detail-oriented, intellectually curious and an effective communicator. This role requires a significant understanding of data mining and analytical techniques.Key ResponsibilitiesPartner closely with Senior Leadership, HR Business Partners, HR colleagues in other functional areas and fellow HR&A team members to identify key workforce issues impacting the business.Use consulting skills to determine and articulate internal customer business questions, develop the best approach for data analysis and turn data into actionable insights & recommendations.Participates in HR analytics projects to investigate potential measures, correlations and causality connections for critical business issuesMerge structured, semi-structured and unstructured data from several systems to highlight company trends related to recruiting, developing, engaging and retaining talentDevelop hypotheses, document assumptions, and analyze results as they relate to key business initiatives.Explore and analyze the data creatively to identify HR analytics solutions that adds value in the strategic decision-making process. Perform complex data analysis and generate insight to support the HR workforce analytics needs of the business, to drive more informed business decisionsUse sophisticated data analytics techniques such as regression analysis, factor analysis, t-tests, decision trees, ANOVA and forecasting methods in application to business problems.Prediction and trend analysis to anticipate the changes in the business, and to enable better decision making.Develop workforce planning frameworks, models and insights to support the business in making data-driven decisions on complex business problemsEffectively communicate statistical analyses, results, and implications to technical and non-technical audiencesDeliver high quality analysis, reports, presentations using simple and effective visualizations that can be scaled for consumption by a larger audience.Stay current on industry trends and best practices regarding human capital/workforce analytics.Create and maintain monthly and quarterly workforce metrics and analysis. Develop processes to streamline the compilation of periodic reporting/analysis  RequirementsMaster’s degree in in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Data Science, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Management Science or Econometrics.3+ years’ experience in a quantitative or analytics roleExperience with Data Analytics using statistical packages and libraries, SQL, visualization tools like Tableau, Business Intelligence (BI) tools, Excel.Preferred experience with R/Python and Hive.Experience with data mining techniques and algorithmsExperience manipulating large data sets through statistical software or other methodsAbility to create ad-hoc queries, join data from multiple sources to perform complex analysisDemonstrated ability to analyze complex issues, form hypotheses, analyze to predict outcomes, determine solutions and recommendations.Works effectively in an unstructured environment requiring new perspectives and creative approaches Stellar communication skills, critical thinking, and a high attention to detailStrong consultative skills and the ability to build relationships with HR and cross-functional partnersAbility to learn quickly and work within tight deadlines; self-starter; must take personal initiative and willingly assume responsibility and ownershipBasic financial knowledge (ROI, basic understanding of financial statements), business acumen.Proven ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a dynamic environmentAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamAbility to innovate through data and analytics to provide new insight to the businessPreferred QualificationsExperience with HRIS systems like WorkdayExperience in HR workforce analytics and HR data and metrics Strong project management skillsApplied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.

Title: Product Science Leader
Description:
Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and highly capable engineering team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
Product Science advances data-driven decision-making using the scientific method on Employer’s products. In the Data Science organization, the Product Science Manager and Product Scientists are embedded working closely with Product Managers and their Engineering teams. Both Product Scientists and Product Science Managers are a mixture of a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer. Product Science Managers maintain the overall vision and specific purposes of the embedded Product Scientist leading the team to achieve maximum impact.

While our Data Scientists largely focus on production machine learning, ML is just one tool in a Product Scientist’s toolbox. Product Scientists use a variety of technical and interpersonal skills with the goal of driving business impact using whatever tools necessary. Typical tasks can range from designing better surveys and A/B tests to building full-service machine learning models while working with product managers and engineering teams to ensure utilization and impact.

About you:
You understand that the best managers serve their teams by removing roadblocks and giving individual contributors autonomy and ownership. You have high standards and will take pride in Employer and push teammates to be better. You have delivered challenging technical solutions at scale. You have led Data Science or Engineering teams, and earned the respect of talented practitioners. You are equally happy talking about deep learning and statistical inference, as you are brainstorming about practical experimental design and technology career development. You love being in the mix technically while providing leadership to your teams.

Requirements

Significant prior success as a Data, Product, or Decision Scientist working on challenging problems at scale
Advanced coursework in statistics, machine learning, programming, or related skills
3+ years of industry experience, with expertise in statistical modeling and/ or machine learning
The ability to guide a team to achieve important goals together
Have full stack experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, productionization, and monitoring
Strong desire to solve tough problems with scientific rigor at scale
An understanding of the value derived from getting results early and iterating
Ability to write and present results to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong ability to coach Product Scientists, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers
Ph.D. or M.S. in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Natural Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Econometrics or Mathematics
Passion to answer Product and Engineering questions with data

We get excited about candidates who can:

Program in R, Python, and/or Java
Fish for data using SQL and/or Pandas
Communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers and product managers

Employer provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs.

View our bounty of perks: [1] http://indeedhi.re/EmployerBenefits

The company uses subject matter experts and innovative data science and technology to help organizations see risks, solve problems, and seize opportunities. Solutions are customized for state and federal agencies as well as industries across the nation. The Qlarant Foundation— the mission arm of the organization—provides grants to services provided in underserved communities. Qlarant employs nearly 500 people and has a 45-year record of accomplishment improving the performance of some of the Nation’s most important programs. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: IDify is a leading identity resolution firm that provides marketers and suppliers with solutions to enable person-level data strategy, analytics, and marketing. Our data allows our clients – including some of the world’s largest marketing platforms, retailers, and publishers - to combine, analyze, and activate data at the person-level to improve ROI and drive profitable, mutually beneficial customer relationships. Our mission is to provide accuracy, transparency, and scale to the new ecosystem of person-level marketing and commerce.  Data and technology are core to our capabilities. We capture billions of data points and digital interactions across our proprietary network of partners and clients and synthesize that data into truth sets that define real people, their relationship to devices and the physical world, and their attributes. We operate as a nimble startup, with a flat org structure that allows every team member to have ownership and authority. We like to move fast, iterate and improve using a learn-by-doing mentality. We’re looking for smart, driven team players who can help us get things done.   IDify is a wholly owned subsidiary of ALC and is backed by world-class investors.  We are currently seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our ALC Digital team of professionals. This position may be based in our Irvine, CAlocation. Our “ideal candidate”should be naturally curious, detailed oriented, have a sharp analytical mind, proficient with a variety of cutting-edge toolsets, a penchant to drive efficiency through automation, and ability to communicate complex concepts to technical and non-technical people alike. You will be responsible fora range of primary data science objectives including designing testing frameworks for data quality and confidence, analyzing structured data from a wide variety of sources, evaluating data partners, and identifying and scoping opportunities to automate repeatable processes. We want to be your Employer of Choice! IDifyoffers excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, 401k w/ company match, paid time off, business casual dress, summer hours, customized training & more!  If you are one of the “best and brightest” in your field and you’re looking to position yourself for the future, this is a great opportunity.   For immediate consideration, please create a profile and make sure you provide your resume, salary requirements, and current contact information.  We look forward to learning more about you and the value you can bring to IDify!  EOE/M/F/D/V  Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to: •                     Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.•                     Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.•                     Implement custom processes for data cleansing and transformation.•                     Utilize multiple tools and programs to analyze and convert source data to a standardized format.•                     Build and maintain documentation for data conversion processes while seeking out process improvements.•                     Perform data quality control reviews and data assessments to identify trends and anomalies.•                     Research new techniques and best practices within the industry. •                     Work with product and engineering to define objectives and develop analytic tools and products. In addition, our "ideal candidate" has the following skills & experience:  •                     Analytical, result driven with high attention to detail.•                     Self-starter, quick learner, problem-solver and someone who relishes challenges.•                     Accomplish targeted performance objectives with a positive and can-do attitude.•                     3+ years using SQL or other query and scripting languages to aggregate, gather, and manipulate data.•                     2+ years using scripting languages such as Python or Bash.•                     Previous internet/mobile industry experience is a plus.•                     Deep understanding of relational databases, ETL tools, data conversion and data cleansing methodologies•                     Experience with (or at least exposure to) cloud-based databases like Redshift, Snowflake, or BigQuery.•                     Experience with Big Data technologies, such as Spark and Hadoop, is a plus.•                     Excellent verbal and written communication skills.•                     Passion for all things data and data-driven solutions.•                     Strong work ethic and high standards for achievement.•                     Bachelor’s in CS, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, or related field. •                     Strong communication, analytical and collaborative problem-solving skills. •                     Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment.•                     Experience with Cloud Platforms such as AWS or Google Cloud is a plus.

Title: Human Capital Analyst
Description: Job SummaryWith over 300 locations across the US, Apria Healthcare’s mission is to improve the quality of life for our 1.8 million patients at home by providing home respiratory services and select medical equipment to help them sleep better, breathe better, heal faster, and thrive longer. Additional information can be found at www.apria.com   JOB SUMMARYThe Human Capital Analyst will report directly to the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence/Data Analytics and serve as an active partner with HR and functional leaders to perform research and analyses on a broad spectrum of talent programs/initiatives: employee attraction and selection, performance, growth, engagement, diversity, compensation, and retention. This role will uncover data-driven insights to better attract, develop, motivate, and retain Apria’s most important asset, our people. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Apply expertise in people research, quantitative analysis, and data visualization to help Apria recruit, select, grow, and retain talent. Translates business questions into data-driven answers. Uses metrics and provides analytic focus for data driven decisions.  Partner with the HR and functional leaders on people projects to identify and clarify critical people issues, deeply understand our people processes, and analyze data to drive improvements. Development, implementation and on-going management of human resources analytics projects. Areas include recruiting, employee lifecycle, benefits, compensation, and integration of HR data into other analytical areas. Develops and maintains data integrity standards to understand associated impacts to reporting and analytics solutions for HR. Assists in the design and management of an enterprise governance model around requests for new HR analytics capabilities, HR reports, HCM/HRIS queries, and changes/enhancements to existing reports. Works with business partners to understand and capture requirements around HR reporting & analytics, facilitates across multiple stakeholders towards decision/resolution, and translates business requirements into reporting solutions. Manages all aspects of HR analytics projects, from project planning to ongoing maintenance. Facilitates coordination between functional and technical subject matter experts as necessary. Responds to ad hoc requests from business partners around HR/Talent analytics. Utilizes HR analytics tool to create reports and dashboards for efficiency, effectiveness, and business outcome reporting to address all levels of audience and governance needs. Communicate statistical analyses and results, along with implications, to technical and non-technical audiences. Ensures business measures are connected to Talent/HR programs and interventions. Demonstrate exceptional judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data. Performs other duties as required. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES N/AMinimum Required QualificationsMINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS  Education and/or Experience Education or experience equivalent to a four-year college degree is required.  Graduate degree highly desired. MS/PhD in a field emphasizing people research in organizations (e.g., Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Behavior, Economics, Management, etc.). 4+ years of progressive analytical experience, conducting quantitative people research in an organization or consulting environment, including working with key stakeholders to understand and clarify their people research needs, and communicating analyses to technical and non-technical audiences. Organizational Skills Advanced Excel skills Intermediate SQL skills Experience managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data using tools such as R or Python Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Professional Designations N/A SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES Has strong HR system analyst skills.  Strong Analytical Skills, Strong Problem-Solving Skills. Strategic thinker with respect to optimizing HR/Talent systems to drive improved processes, and exceptional employee and manager experiences. Experience with analyzing large amounts of data, interpreting, and communicating results. Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects and handle cross-functional team interactions. Strong problem solver with a high standard for deliverables. Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to write correspondence, reports, and presentations to effectively present information.  Outstanding analytical, reasoning and problem-solving skills; ability to determine root causes and provide solutions. Strong data visualization skills required. Experience in Business Intelligence tools including Tableau, Microsoft BI, Cognos BI, and or DOMO preferred. Proficient in writing stored procedures in T-SQL. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Computer Skills Expert level experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Understanding of relational database principles. Language Skills English (reading, writing, verbal) Mathematical Skills College level mathematical skills PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (only include Preferred Qualifications if needed) Education and/or Experience 2+ years of experience with machine learning, text mining or modeling high-dimensional data Experience developing tools, conducting empirical research, practical implementation, knowledge of best practices in at least three of the following areas: employee selection, employee engagement, performance management, diversity, or retention. Experience conceiving, developing, running pilot tests, implementing, and continuously improving large-scale people processes Experienced in survey design Experience in data science and creating models is a plus Computer Skills Familiarity with enterprise systems and data, statistical, and database (SQL) packages preferred. Experience with payroll and talent management technologies & be adept at accessing, aggregating, and analyzing data. PHYSICAL DEMANDSThis is a stationary position that requires frequent sitting or standing, repetitive wrist motions, grasping, speaking, listening, close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.  It also may require occasional lifting, carrying, walking, climbing, kneeling, bending/stooping, twisting, pulling/pushing, walking, bending, stooping, and reaching above the shoulder.  Employees in this position must be physically able to efficiently perform the essential functions of the position. Reasonable accommodations will be provided to assist or enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position, upon request. WORK ENVIRONMENTWork is performed in an office setting with exposure to moderate noise.  TRAVEL Occasional travel as required. OTHER INFORMATIONThe essential duties and responsibilities, physical requirements, and work environment described above are representative of those typically required for this position but may vary depending on staffing and business needs at specific locations. The inclusion or omission of a specific duty or physical requirement is, therefore, not determinative of whether that function is essential to a specific individual’s position.EEO StatementAs an EOE/AA employer, Apria Healthcare is committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal access to employment opportunities, regardless of sex, race, age, color, national origin, disability, pregnancy, religion, genetic information, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.  Apria Healthcare shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of protected veteran status or disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. Title: Chair, Department Of Biomedical Informatics: Western Michigan University Homer Stryker MD School Of Medicine
Description: Western Michigan University Homer Stryker M.D. School of Medicine (WMed) seeks an exceptional leader to serve as the Founding Chair of the Department of Biomedical Informatics. The department will provide education to medical and graduate students and also lead the development of collaborative research and scholarly activities in biomedical informatics. An ACGME-accredited fellowship leading to board certification in Clinical Informatics is planned with department and medical school faculty already in place. The department will also play a central role in the development of a new practice-based research network for faculty across the medical school and the Kalamazoo area. WMed, a private, nonprofit corporation supported by gifts, clinical revenues, research activities, tuition, and endowment income, is fully accredited by the LCME and also by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC). The inaugural medical student class graduated in 2018 after completing an innovative, patient-centered four-year curriculum that prepares them to be exceptional clinicians, leaders, educators, advocates, and researchers of tomorrow. There are more than 200 residents and fellows in ten residencies and three fellowships accredited by the ACGME WMed is a collaboration involving Western Michigan University, a national public doctoral university, and two award-winning teaching hospitals, Ascension Borgess Health and Bronson Healthcare, both nationally recognized for innovation and quality. The primary outpatient site for the medical school is a modern 60,000 square foot building on the Oakland Drive Campus. The 350,000 square foot educational building on the W.E. Upjohn M.D. Campus located in downtown Kalamazoo—is the result of a $78 million design and expansion project including two laboratory research floors and a state-of-the-art Simulation Center that is accredited by the Society for Simulation in Healthcare. The Innovation Center on the Parkview Campus is a life science, technology, and engineering incubator serving the earliest startups to maturing companies. Kalamazoo is a wonderful and vibrant city, located midway between Chicago and Detroit. It is a short distance from Lake Michigan, and home to two nationally ranked institutions of higher learning, Western Michigan University and Kalamazoo College. Kalamazoo is known for its community focus and emphasis on access to quality education at all levels. The Kalamazoo Promise is a nationally renowned program in which graduates of Kalamazoo Public Schools receive free tuition to attend public and private colleges in Michigan. Candidates should have clinical training and experience across the full range of domains from bioinformatics to genomics to population health, with special expertise in clinical informatics and the emerging field of health data science. Additional qualifications include: medical degree and advanced training in a domain of biomedical informatics from an accredited program in informatics or data science, or board certification in clinical informatics; experience in a medical school setting with a working understanding of the clinical, educational, and research mission; eligibility for appointment at the rank of Associate Professor or Professor. For immediate consideration please inquire with an updated copy of your CV so we can discuss the position by phone. Also, inform me of your best available times to speak. I look forward to your reply and thank you for your review. Please do not delay as we anticipate a significant response.  Please contact Jay Torio at medcareers@merritthawkins.com or at (866) 406-0269 and reference BIO-94712   YourMembership. Category:Education, Keywords:Department Chair, Location:San Diego, CA-92130

Description: Did you know that our employee benefits start on the first day of employment? Join eXcell   httpwww.excell.com and enjoy our generous, DayOne Benefits (SM)!  nbsp  nbsp Our client has played a critical part in forming meaningful communities where people can connect with each other and share what matters most to them, strengthening their relationships through shared experiences. For this position, we are looking for a seasoned Researcher with broad skills in both qualitative and quantitative research methods. nbsp  nbsp The right candidate will be an excellent communicator, knowledgeable about user experience design and research, comfortable in a flat, fast moving organization, excited to collaborate, and passionate about social media and understanding ad experiences. nbsp  nbsp Responsibilities  Design and execute studies that address both user behavior and attitudes, using the right methodology for the right questions  Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long term product strategy  Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods and quantitative methods  Work cross-functionally with design, product management, data science, engineering, marketing, and content strategy  Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways  Qualifications  5+ years of Mixed Methods experience preferred  Some Quantitative experience required  Experience in cross functional discussions with leads and being an advocate for user insights for the design and development process  Experience working with stakeholders to scope and prioritize projects  Ability to design and field surveys within the app  Experience managing ongoing qualitative research programs  Experience working with large-scale data in multi-method studies  Experience with survey design and bias correction  Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods  Command of qualitative and user-centered design methods, from ethnographic to usability to survey design and analysis  Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful business questions  Experience communicating with internal stakeholders including but not limited to Product Managers, Designers, Product Marketers, and Engineers  Can work independently and prioritize time between multiple projects, and be flexible by adapting to changing schedules and different projects   nbsp We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, arrest, and conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. This includes the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance as well as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. nbsp  nbsp W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time. eXcell  httpwww.excell.com  Supports Equal Employment Opportunity eXcell  httpwww.excell.com  , a division of CompuCom Systems, Inc., a global company headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, provides IT staffing services and solutions to Fortune 1000 companies as well as small and medium business. For more information, visit www.excell.com  httpwww.excell.com . nbsp

Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa   Pluses Recommended certification in BI, DW, SQL, AWS, AI or Machine Learning Experience with data science and machine learning tools  techniques Exposure to AI solutions in the Data  Analytics space Demonstration of thought leadership, community volunteering, recognition or awards Masterrsquos degree in technology or business   Responsibilities Leading discovery, planning, and architecture design of data and analytics solutions Supporting or developing solutions for machine learning and deep learning Building solutions for data ingestion, compute, and consumption Writing database queries, flows and movements Obtaining and maintaining technical certifications in these core areas of expertise

Title: Big Data Engineer
Description: VARITE is looking for a qualified Sr. Big Data Engineer for one of its clients located in Emeryville, CA. If you are interested in this opportunity, kindly respond ASAP with your updated resume. We will be glad to represent you to our client and help in your job search. WHAT THE CLIENT DOES? Client is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with world-renowned real estate brands. WHAT WE DO? VARITE is a global IT company providing software and engineering consulting and team augmentation services to Fortune 1000 companies in USA, CANADA and INDIA. VARITE is currently a primary and direct vendor to the leading corporations in the areas of Cloud, Data Sciences, Infrastructure Application Software, Mobility, Robotics, Banking  Financial Systems. HERE'S WHAT YOUrsquoLL DO  At Client, we work to build and improve a platform that helps real estate professionals work effectively, and helps delight home buyers and sellers with an excellent experience. We do that by combining great technology with great people ndash and wersquore looking for a Senior Big Data Engineer to join our team. What wersquore looking for Yoursquore a talented, creative, and motivated engineer who loves developing powerful, stable, and intuitive apps ndash and yoursquore excited to work with a team of individuals with that same passion. Yoursquove accumulated years of experience, and yoursquore excited about taking your mastery of Big Data and Java to a new level. You enjoy challenging projects involving big data sets and are cool under pressure. Yoursquore no stranger to fast-paced environments and agile development methodologies ndash in fact, you embrace them. With your strong analytical skills, your unwavering commitment to quality, your excellent technical skills, and your collaborative work ethic, yoursquoll do great things here at Client. What yoursquoll do As a Senior Big Data Engineer, yoursquoll be responsible for designing and building high performance, scalable data solutions that meet the needs of millions of agents, brokers, home buyers, and sellers. Yoursquoll design, develop, and test robust, scalable data platform components. Yoursquoll work with a variety of teams and individuals, including product engineers to understand their data pipeline needs and come up with innovative solutions. Yoursquoll work with a team of talented engineers and collaborate with product managers and designers to help define new data products and features. Skills, accomplishments, interests you should have bull BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline or equivalent combination of training and experience bull 6+ years core Java experience building business logic layers and back-end systems for high-volume pipelines bull Experience with spark streaming and scala bull Current experience in Spark, Hadoop, MapReduce and HDFS, Cassandra  HBase bull Understanding of data flows, data architecture, ETL and processing of structured and unstructured data bull Current experience using Java development, SQL Database systems, and Apache products bull Experience with high-speed messaging frameworks and streaming (kafka, akka,reactive) bull Current experience developing and deploying applications to a public cloud (AWS, GCE) bull Experience with DevOps tools (GitHub, TravisCI, Jira) and methodologies (Lean, Agile, Scrum, Test Driven Development) bull Experience with data science and machinedeep learning a plus bull Ability to work quickly with an eye towards writing clean code that is efficient and reusable bull Ability to build prototypes for new features that will delight our users and are consistent with business goals bull Ability to iterate quickly in an agile development process bull Ability to learn new technologies and evaluate multiple technologies to solve a problem bull Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English bull Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Nice to haves bull Experience mentoring or acting in a lead capacity WHAT YOUrsquoLL NEED TO WIN  Scala, JAVA, Spark, Big Data, Scala, JAVA, Spark, Big Data IF THIS OPPORTUNITY INTERESTS YOU, PLEASE RESPOND WITH THE FOLLOWING DETAILS  Resume with contact details Current location Currently working or not working Work authorization Best time to call  VARITE is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

Title: Lead Full Stack Engineer
Description: Lead Full Stack Engineer Location San Francisco, CA Duration PermanentDirect Compensation Extremely competitive compensation package Start Date ASAP   Our San Francisco client is a small, but growing, food-tech company (w substantial financial backing) with the goal of empowering families to eat healthier meals.  They are building an intelligent platform that uses advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques to both generate personalized meal recommendations and reinforce better eating habits. To achieve this goal they have assembled a team of smart, empirically motivated, disagreeable givers who care about making a difference in the world. They believe that using technology, collaboration, innovation and diversity we can transform the way people eat and cook. As an early employee, you will greatly impact the design and development of our client's product. We are looking for creative people who are comfortable with ambiguity and enjoy learning and teaching as part of a dynamic team.   What will you be working on? Lead the backend and frontend software architecture of our consumer-facing mobile applications. Collaborate with Product Designers and Managers to iterate on the design and implementation of product Manage technical and product development projects with business stakeholders Work with Data Scientists and Data Platform Engineers to enrich customer experience using unique data products. Help build and enable a teachable platform to strengthen personalization of our recommendations. Identify technical solutions and help prioritize work across our engineering team. Mentor and provide guidance to both junior and senior engineers. Architect and implement efficient and reusable systems and abstractions Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues  Do you have the right chops? You have experience leading engineering teams, providing technical and mentoring expertise. You have collaborated well and effectively with a product, design, and engineering organization. You have created engineering roadmaps and processes to improve and extend current product capabilities. You are experienced with client-side web and and native application development, including web libraries and app frameworks such as React native, Angular, Ionic, and CSS cross browser development and optimizing front end performance experience with native application development with technologies like React Native is preferred  You are experienced with backend application engineering, including Extensive knowledge of at least one programming language in addition to JavaScript familiarity with a server-side web framework, e.g. Flask, Django, NodeJS, or Sinatra you have designed, implemented, monitored and maintained successful RESTful APIs you have experience with a variety of databases, including relational databases and at least  one non-relational database.  At least 3 years related work experience A solid understanding of the fundamentals of sustainable software development and like to experiment with cutting edge web development and UI technologies Excellent communication skills  About you You enjoy working on a small agile dynamic team where everyone is valued You are creative, like learning new skills and teaching others You are motivated to have a positive impact on the world and want to work on a diverse set of problems You believe that work should be fun and enjoy working with others You like to try new things and believe in failing fast   Qualified candidates are encouraged to select "apply now" and send updated resume for consideration.        Keywords Application Development, Mobile, Web, Full Stack, React, Native, Ionic, Angular, CSS, React Native, Flask, Django, NodeJS, Sinatra, RESTful, API, NoSQL, Agile, UI

Title: Director Business Intelligence
Description: Director of Business Intelligence will create and lead a best-in-class data, analytics and insights capability including managing the data warehouse, developing reporting dashboards and scorecards, and evangelizing the use of analytical tools  techniques throughout the company. Leads a team of analytical professionals in establishing metrics, providing innovative data analyses and partnering with department professionals to support their business intelligence needs. This candidate will be technically strong and will enhance our capabilities to make data-driven decisions and recommendations. This individual will collaborate with leadership and directs teams to assure strategic, operational and developmental goals of the organization are met. This is a hands-on, build position that will be instrumental in building the data warehouse structure and shaping the company culture around data-driven decision making and governance.   What yoursquoll do   The responsibilities include directing the development, implementation and enterprise wide adoption of tools, systems, and processes designed to support the organizationrsquos information and data needs. Responsible for managing the day-to-day tactical team operations including data preparation, data warehousing, reporting, analytics, data exploration, information delivery (portals, mobile), BI competency center or center of excellence. Develop a comprehensive BI program and work with the Business groups to provide frequent insight and business intelligence to help them make data-backed decisions Responsible for leading design and development activities related to enterprise data warehouses solutions for the organization. Integrate corporate reporting by extracting data from a variety of sources as well. Partner with senior management to understand and deliver performance insights and key analytics solutions. Build, mentor, and guide business intelligence team to provide BI technical solutions as well as actionable information. Provide expertise and leadership in the master data management disciplines of data governance, Meta-data management, data quality and master data integration and architecture. Other duties required by Management      Qualifications   Bachelorrsquos Degree in Computer Sciences, Information Systems or related fields. 10+ years of experience leading Business Intelligence andor analytics with track record of increasing leadership growth, complexity and responsibilities. 7+ years of relevant experience in a visualization development, data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology. Business acumen with the ability to understand the commercial, operational and financial priorities of the business and align analytics initiatives and activities on the areas of highest impact. Practical Analytical Analytically rooted balanced with a practical side that has a bias toward action versus paralysis by perfection. Fearless Leadership ndash highly-disciplined self-starter with a strong POV who can positively, effectively lead themselves and others, often in ambiguous andor new territory. Communication ndash proficient verbally and in writing as this person will work with across the organization to champion a data-based culture. Experience with Tableau, Power BI or equivalency to create impactful reports, visualizations, and interactive dashboards that influence behavior. Understands the range of options and best practices for common ETL design techniques such as change data capture, key generation and optimization. Knowledge of SQL (HiveQL, T-SQL, PLSQL, etc.) to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data. Programming skills in Python to cleanse, manipulate, and present data Programming skills in R for statistical modeling. Proficient in new and emerging technologies. Good understanding of data architecture in a cloud environment with Azure, AWS, Google or other. Experience in Ecommerce with subscriptions is preferred. Broad experience across different database technologies both relational and non-relation MS SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Cassandara    PREFERED SKILLS Bachelorrsquos Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP)      LegalZoom is an Equal Opportunity Employer, dedicated to diversity.   We are unable to accept applicants who currently or in the future will require a work Visa.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description: Title Operations Analyst Duration 12-Month Contract Location Mountain View, CA  Pay 42hr. - 61hr.  Our Client is a self-driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to move around. As an Operations Analyst, you will evaluate and improve our Client's products and offerings. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of extremely data-driven engineers, product managers, systems engineers and leadership on a wide range of problems. You will be responsible for updating, creating, and keeping online critical data pipelines, scripts, dashboards and visualization tools, so that the organization can continue making data-driven decisions around the clock. They will rely on you for data quality, analytical and statistical rigor to measure quality, performance, and readiness of various facets of our self-driving technology. In this role your main focus will be  Working with large, complex data sets.  Solving difficult data analysis problems by organizing and defining data logic, and applying advanced analytical methods when needed.  Yoursquoll be conducting end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, cleaning, analysis and presentations.  Maintain critical dashboards and pipelines to drive decision making and make it more robust over time, applying version control and unit testing to code and dashboards.  Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale.  Develop comprehensive understanding of the Client's data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for both products development and sales activity.  Additionally yoursquoll be  Interacting cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams.  Yoursquoll work closely with engineers to identify opportunities for improvement to the Client's products.  Conducting Experimentation, forecasting, time dependent analysis  Yoursquoll make business recommendations through effective presentations for various levels of stakeholders.  Manage, consolidate, and prioritize an influx of requests from multiple teams.  Required Skills  Bachelors in a quantitative discipline (ie statistics, operations research, economics, or a quantitative STEM field)  2 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or a related field  1-2 yearsrsquo experience with statistical software (e.g. pandas, R, MATLAB)  2+ yearsrsquo Experience with database languages (e.g. SQL)  Experience with version control (such as Git)  Effective written and verbal communication skills  Demonstrated leadership and self-direction with the ability to work independently  Nice to Have Skills  Experience as an engineer, statistician, informatician, data analyst, data scientist  Demonstrated analytical engagements outside of work  Demonstrated willingness to teach others and learn new techniques  Experience translating analysis results into business recommendations

Title: VP of Engineering
Description: As the world’s largest retailer, Company has an unmatched retail data asset, and we have the opportunity to use data to deliver lower prices, better products and help our customers live better. We are transforming the way that we work to become the world’s leading data-driven retailer, and are seeking an experienced business leader to manage Company’s data asset spanning data acquisition (across internal sources and third party partnerships), quality, governance, compliance and engineering. This initiative covers all areas of Company’s business across stores, e-commerce, supply, merchandising and customer interactions, and this role is a central leadership element in Company’s overall data strategy mission. The Data Enablement Lead will report to the Chief Data Officer, and will collaborate with senior executives from across the business including the leaders of key functional domains (e.g. supply chain, merchandising, customer), business lines (e.g. online grocery, health and wellness), technology teams and enterprise functions (e.g. HR, legal and procurement).  Key Responsibilities:   Protecting and governing our data asset   Develop and drive adoption of policies and procedures for the management, governance, and productization of Enterprise Data assets, including monitoring/audit and issue escalation paths   Define standards for managing data across its lifecycle at Company (across domain-specific data marts and operational stores, and the central data warehouse/lake)   Create the framework for handling governance globally to support local market needs and compliance regulations   Define and track ownership of datasets across Company   Define, measure and report on data quality and availability, and develop a plan within and across domains to improve these metrics   Work with data stewards to identify appropriate measures and levels of quality and determine the work required to deliver high quality data   Identify critical datasets that are used across domains, and lead the agreement of standards and ownership that will ensure effective availability and quality of these datasets   Run cross-company executive forums (lead the Data Risk and Protection Forum, and support Data Value Creation Forum) to share best practice, resolve interdependencies and drive progress   Maintain a single catalog for data across Company, with appropriate rich metadata to enable productive self-service usage   Ensure that corporate and regulatory policies for data handling are implemented in specific procedures and tools for security, retention, access and storage   Partner with the data & analytics technology platform team to ensure that tools are fit for purpose and support an agile and scalable organization, particulary in relation to data governance and stewardship   Define and drive adoption of best practices for data stewards, and establish target skills, career path, training programs and best practice sharing events for this community   Increase Company’s readiness to understand, manage, and drive responsible insights from its data assets. Partnering with the broader CDO team, develop and implement training modules, webinars, and collateral to drive awareness and action on industry best practices, tools, and capabilities.   Delivery of self-service access to clean, usable data for our business users, analysts, developers and data scientists   Manage Data Solution teams in defining the transformations and engineering work required to deliver datasets with the appropriate characteristics (e.g. format, completeness/coverage, quality, latency) for the desired usage patterns and use cases, drawing on input from the Data Value Lead, data stewards and domain product managers   Managing Data Engineering teams in the delivery of data transformation pipelines and self-service data environmentCompany SummaryThe Company eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world’s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better.  With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.Position SummaryAs the world’s largest retailer, Company has an unmatched retail data asset, and we have the opportunity to use data to deliver lower prices, better products and help our customers live better. Title: VP of Engineering
Description: About the Role: Company is on a mission to end food waste in the world and to build a better food system for everyone. Tens of thousands of Americans agree and Imperfect’s business is on a fast growth trajectory as a result. Adapting how we engineer through this growth is essential to our success. The Vice President of Engineering (VPE) will be responsible for developing and mentoring a team of distributed engineers who design, develop, deliver, and maintain Imperfect’s e-commerce and technology platform. (The position can be based at our headquarters in San Francisco or can be remote.) We are believers that good leaders intimately understand the challenges of their employees; as such, we expect you to stay active in programming (20% of your time) as part of this role. You understand Agile principles and processes and their role in a start-up environment. You are a strong communicator and practice open and transparent management Ours is a team of about 10 (and growing) seasoned professionals who are highly productive and builds things iteratively because we believe that the right answer comes from a mix of design and discovery.  To that end, we’re neither dogmatic nor trend-seeking — we’re simply out to build the best product for customers possible. Sometimes that calls for “boring” tech, and sometimes that calls for “bleeding edge” tech. Your addition to our team will make all of this more delightful. ResponsibilitiesBuild, lead, and scale a high-quality engineering team, and demonstrate a passion to recruit, mentor and develop top talentArchitect large web-scale systems and manage the full cycle including development, implementation, and maintenanceClosely collaborate with Product Management to develop and drive the product engineering roadmap, and document and report progress against stated goalsDevelop processes for experimentation where engineers are empowered to rapidly test and deploy their ideas, and champion a culture of measurement, accountability, and qualityForward plan for rapid growth in subscribers, order volume, average order value, grocery product SKU expansion, and geographic expansion into new marketsBuild increasingly data-centric products (AI/ML) and Data Engineering/Data Science capacity and expertise in the teamAdvise the engineering team and stakeholders throughout the company on the evaluation and selection of open source and third-party tools and platforms to increase our development efficiency and improve our technology and product platformsSkills and Qualifications:4+ years engineering management experience, ideally in a rapid-growth consumer start-up environmentAn additional 6+ years software engineering experience in backend or full stack development, including experience with AWS, Docker, CircleCI, Node.js, React/Redux, F#, .NET, Python, Javascript, RabbitMQ, Kinesis/Lambda, Postgres, Snowflake, Segment or comparable technologiesProven, demonstrable success in delivering product in a fast moving agile/scrum development environmentBS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent work experienceAbout You:Experience working with managing remote teamsNatural ability to successfully collaborate, especially with other teams to meet their needs (Product Management, Warehouse & Delivery Operations, Marketing, Customer Care, Supply, etc.)A passion for the Imperfect mission to end food waste in the world and build a better food system for everyone

Title: Data Engineer (Python)
Description: Data Engineer   Can you envision working closely with all aspects of data from application to cloud services?   Come Join our team as a Data Engineer !!!   At 8x8, we have many opportunities to work with data on a daily basis.  Can you envision working on data and build the infrastructure that are critical to drive valuable business insight. How about building a scalable data pipelines to drive critical data analysis for our end users and enable data science experimentation? Title: VP of Advance Analytics

Our real-time healthcare intelligence engine provides healthcare business leaders the ability to modernize and improve the way they engage and serve the medical community, and the result is a more transparent, efficient and productive healthcare ecosystem, ultimately leading to reduced patient disease burden. Our Advanced Analytics practice seeks experienced and entrepreneurial leaders who are ready to lead and grow an Advanced Analytics team. This is an excellent opportunity for accomplished Life Sciences leaders to have massive impact at a fast-growing technology company. The Vice President, Advanced Analytics, will lead and grow the Company Advanced Analytics function to deliver customer value through Komodo’s analytics services capabilities. The role requires comfort interfacing with a diverse set of internal stakeholders (Product, Engineering, People, Finance) and Life Sciences customers ranging from Commercial (Marketing, Sales, and Analytics), Medical Affairs, Clinical Operations, Market Access, and Real-World Evidence, and an ability to engage, communicate, consult, and partner effectively. At Company, we value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions and services that “wow” our customers. Company is backed by leading technology investors on the East and West Coasts, and is partnered with leading academic institutions, technology leaders and life sciences thought leaders. Title: Head of Analytics
Description: Company is a data-driven financial technology company. Data science and analytics are core to our decision making processes, from automated credit underwriting and servicing to creating new products for our consumers. We seek to revolutionize the credit system by building higher quality alternatives to incumbent systems and methods. We are looking for an analytics leader to head our product and marketing analytics team. The role will be responsible for both building and leading a high-performing team, and also delivering a clear data narrative around our customers, products, and marketing efforts. Success requires analytical savvy, problem-solving sophistication, and a dedication to make the highest impact possible. We are looking for someone that can think on their feet and thrives in a dynamic environment. You will have plenty of opportunities to present directly to our senior leadership team. Your impact will be felt immediately! What you will doAct as a curator of data by defining, instrumenting, and tracking necessary analytics of our products alongside engineering and product teamsSynthesize business insights and communicate a data narrative around product usage and marketing and tying this into the overall Company strategySet a compelling vision and prioritize work based on business partner objectives and overall goalsLead a high-performing, high-throughput team of talented Analysts, while driving professional development goals of the teamWork with the team to manage the end-to-end process: scope projects, build pipelines and datasets, synthesize results, craft automated dashboards/bots, and communicate an informed recommendation. Jump in when needed!Partner closely with our Product and Engineering leadership teams to influence planning and prioritizationCommunicate solutions confidently and effectively across all levels of the organizationWhat we look forPassion and drive to change consumer banking for the better8+ years of data analytics work experience and 2+ years of management experienceA proven track record of using quantitative analysis to impact key decisionsAbility to build clear and concise presentations, and communicate effectively with managers and executivesExperience dealing with unstructured business issues and successfully leading teams to resolve these issuesExperience writing SQL queries and working with large data setsStrong project management skillsUnderstanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages, such as R, Python, etc.BA/BS degree. Graduate degree a plus

Shape is backed by renowned investors such as Y Combinator and Stanford StartX.Our first product,ShapeScale, is the first photorealistic 3D body scanner that shows you how your body shape changes over time. It's not only a game changer for fitness but also an enabler for a number of fashion, healthcare, and AR / VR applications. We have recently started to take pre-orders for ShapeScale and have thus far received thousands of pre-orders.Shape is looking for a talentedSenior Data Scientist/ Geometric Deep Learningwith an entrepreneurial spirit to join our team and help us achieve our technology goals. frameworks and libraries e.g., Tensorflow, Pytorch, Caffe, Keras, PointNet, ShapeNet, etc..Experience in training and evaluation of computer vision algorithms on large datasets.Outstanding skills in Python, C & C++ with experience in writing robust and maintainable production code.Experience in developing computer vision/imaging and machine learning algorithms for embedded and non embedded platforms.Knowledge of object classification, template matching, or other machine learning methods for computer vision.Comfortable with 3D computational geometry, linear algebra, statistics, numerical 3D deep neural networks; you have created 3D deep neural networks and seen them through to high performance and/or have published papers at the top conferences.Prior experience involving 3D scanning Scrum / Kanban / etc.Knowledge of scripting language, e.g. Python, Bash, etc.Camera and/or video pipeline knowledge and experience.BENEFITSCompetitive salary and equityFlexible work schedule, unlimited holidays with a mandatory 15 days / year off.Great, comprehensive health insurance : low deductible - 100% covered (incl. dependents)Visa sponsorship if necessaryCatered lunches with healthy eating options suitable for all diets and allergies and healthy snacksTop of the line Apple and Windows equipment of choice that you think you need to work comfortably and efficientlyMotorized sit / standing desk with Herman Miller or Steelcase chairs.Fitness discounts and fun, action-inspired company-wide events and outings, gaming eveningsCommuter benefits or subsidiesOffice located at the heart of San Francisco (SoMa)A fun, creative and collaborative environment of a young startup company with a driven, agile and adept international teamThe opportunity to have an impact on millions of people and make them happier and healthier

Title: Chief Product Officer
Description: Job Description Our vision is a world where mental health is never an obstacle. We are looking for an experienced product leader that wants to make a huge impact on the world - in this case, by disrupting the behavioral health space to deliver on-demand access to cost-effective support. As part of the senior leadership team, you will work with the CEO, engineering, design and data science leadership, and will partner with sales, marketing, clinical and account management teams to deliver innovative solutions to create access, efficiency and ultimately transform the behavioral health space. You will be responsible for the full product cycle -- working with leadership to refine the product vision, building product roadmap & strategy, building short-term and long-term milestones, executing on the product, shipping and launching. Skills & ExperienceMinimum 8 years product management leadership in fast growth B2B and B2C  technology environmentsExperience shipping high-quality, consumer grade mobile or web productsGood cross-team communications skills - especially with sales, marketing & clinical teamsWell-developed product instinct, e.g. what makes great consumer products & whyGood prioritization process, e.g. how to balance requirements vs. resourcingWell respected manager adept at hiring and developing world-class talentNice-to-HavesMix of large company experience and startup-experiencePast background in engineering, product metrics/analytics or designEngineering or computer science degree

Title: Head of Marketing
Description: Company is the first company with a clinically-proven treatment to safely and sustainably balance blood sugar, lower A1C, and reduce weight using food as medicine and leveraging the profile of a patient’s gut-microbiome, without the use of medications or surgery. Our innovations in nutritional biochemistry, data science and digital tools combined with our clinical expertise are shifting the diabetes treatment paradigm from management to reversal.   The Head of Marketing will be responsible for leading the marketing organization focused on B2B enterprise marketing and B2C enrollment marketing supporting the company’s continued growth. This leader will have deep expertise in B2B marketing while serving as the team’s overall leader in an effort to further drive Company’s scale in the payer and employer space. The Head of Marketing will build and execute sustainable and scalable B2B marketing campaigns across all core market segments including employer, payer, channels, and strategic partners. This role will lead demand generation, marketing enablement, product marketing, and contract creative team, as well as B2C enrollment marketing. This individual must have commensurate executive presence required to lead marketing and communications efforts in such a way as to expand Company’s brand awareness with existing and potential clients and partners, and elevate the understanding of digital health with the public and legislative bodies.   The Head of Marketing will also be a driver of the company's commercial strategy, leveraging expertise in the healthcare space and sensitivity to healthcare data by understanding the complexity of the employer, payer, channel, and partner markets. Importantly, s/he must be an exceptional team-builder and collaborator internally with other departments. The Head of Marketing is a key member of the executive leadership team.
